main event: A possible nose cone or falling object was observed by an aircraft over the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The object was described as 'brilliantly brilliant' with an incandescent tail that remained visible for approximately one mile.
The object was sighted at an altitude of 100 feet and at coordinates 36.2N 173.9W.
The sighting occurred at 15:13Z on October 6, 1967.
The object was observed at an elevation of approximately 45 degrees and a bearing of 245 degrees true, before disappearing over the horizon to the southwest.
The report indicates that this information was forwarded to various military commands, including CINCPACAF, COMHAWSEAFRON, and CINCNORAD.
sighted object: possible nose cone or falling object
